settings.text:
they have washed their robes
and made them white in the Blood of the Lamb.”

living creatures.
They prostrated themselves before the throne,
worshiped God, and exclaimed:
“Amen.  Blessing and glory, wisdom and thanksgiving,
honor, power, and might
be to our God forever and ever.  Amen."

Then one of the elders spoke up and said to me,
“Who are these wearing white robes, and where did they come from?”
I said to him, “My lord, you are the one who knows.”
He said to me,
“These are the ones who have survived the time of great distress;

from every tribe of the children of Israel.

After this I had a vision of a great multitude,
which no one could count,
from every nation, race, people, and tongue.
They stood before the throne and before the Lamb,
wearing white robes and holding palm branches in their hands.
They cried out in a loud voice:
“Salvation comes from our God, who is seated on the throne,
and from the Lamb.”

All the angels stood around the throne
and around the elders and the four
R. Glory to you, O Lord.
A reading from the Gospel according to Matthew.
R. And with your Spirit
The Lord be with you.

I believe in the Holy Spirit,
the holy catholic Church,
the communion of saints,
the forgiveness of sins,
the resurrection of the body,
and life everlasting. Amen.
Apostle's Creed
The Gospel of the Lord

sources.name: Praise to you Lord Jesus Christ

settings.text: R: Praise to you Lord Jesus Christ

Blessed are the clean of heart,
for they will see God.
Blessed are the peacemakers,
for they will be called children of God.
Blessed are they who are persecuted for the sake of righteousness,
for theirs is the Kingdom of heaven.
Blessed are you when they insult you and persecute you
and utter every kind of evil against you falsely because of me.
Rejoice and be glad,
for your reward will be great in heaven.”

items.name: Praise to you Lord Jesus Christ

settings.text: Gospel
Alleluia

When Jesus saw the crowds, he went up the mountain,
and after he had sat down, his disciples came to him. 
He began to teach them, saying:
“Blessed are the poor in spirit,
for theirs is the Kingdom of heaven.
Blessed are they who mourn,
for they will be comforted.
Blessed are the meek,
for they will inherit the land.
Blessed are they who hunger and thirst for righteousness,
for they will be satisfied.
Blessed are the merciful,
for they will be shown mercy.

Come to me, all you who labor and are burdened,
and I will give you rest, says the Lord.
R. Alleluia, alleluia.

He shall receive a blessing from the LORD,
a reward from God his savior.
Such is the race that seeks him,
that seeks the face of the God of Jacob.
R. Lord, this is the people that longs to see your face.

The LORD’s are the earth and its fullness;
the world and those who dwell in it.
For he founded it upon the seas
and established it upon the rivers.

Along with this livestream Mass, we are celebrating Mass in church with New York State’s requirement of limited capacity and social distancing.  

Be sure to check our facebook page, your emails and the parish office phone message for any updates.

Weekday Masses are being celebrated at 8:30 a.m. Monday through Friday without reservations.

Today's readings are:
EX 22:20-26
1 THES 1:5C-10
MT 22:34-40

St. Theodore's Church
Solemnity of All Saints
November 1, 2020 9:00am

My Jesus, 
I believe that You are present in the Most Holy Sacrament. 
I love You above all things, 
and I desire to receive You into my soul. 
Since I cannot at this moment receive You sacramentally, 
come at least spiritually into my heart. 
I embrace You as if You were already there 
and unite myself wholly to You. 
Never permit me to be separated from You.

Amen.

Thank you for attending
May God bless you

I, John, saw another angel come up from the East,
holding the seal of the living God.
He cried out in a loud voice to the four angels
who were given power to damage the land and the sea,
“Do not damage the land or the sea or the trees
until we put the seal on the foreheads of the servants of our God.”
I heard the number of those who had been marked with the seal,
one hundred and forty-four thousand marked
Reading 1
The Word of the Lord
R: Thanks Be to God
Responsorial Psalm

Beloved:
See what love the Father has bestowed on us
that we may be called the children of God.
Yet so we are.
The reason the world does not know us
is that it did not know him.
Beloved, we are God’s children now;
what we shall be has not yet been revealed.
We do know that when it is revealed we shall be like him,
for we shall see him as he is.
Reading 2

Glory to God in the highest,
and on earth peace to people of good will.

We praise you,
we bless you,
we adore you,
we glorify you,
we give you thanks for your great glory,
Lord God, heavenly King,
O God, almighty Father.

Lord Jesus Christ, Only Begotten Son,
Lord God, Lamb of God, Son of the Father,
you take away the sins of the world, have mercy on us;
you take away the sins of the world,
Gloria

receive our prayer;
you are seated at the right hand of the Father, have mercy on us.

For you alone are the Holy One,
you alone are the Lord,
you alone are the Most High,
Jesus Christ,
with the Holy Spirit,
in the glory of God the Father. Amen.
Nicene Creed

I believe in one God,
the Father almighty,
maker of heaven and earth,
of all things visible and invisible.

I believe in one Lord Jesus Christ,
the Only Begotten Son of God,
born of the Father before all ages.
God from God, Light from Light,
true God from true God,
begotten, not made, consubstantial with the Father;
through him all things were made.
For us men and for our salvation
he came down from heaven,
(Bow) and by the Holy Spirit was incarnate of the Virgin Mary,
and became man. (End Bow)

For our sake he was crucified under Pontius Pilate,
he suffered death and was buried,
and rose again on the third day
in accordance with the Scriptures.
He ascended into heaven
and is seated at the right hand of the Father.
He will come again in glory
to judge the living and the dead
and his kingdom will have no end.

I believe in the Holy Spirit, the Lord, the giver of life,
who proceeds from the Father and the Son,
who with the Father and the Son is adored and glorified,
who has spoken through the prophets.

I believe in one, holy, catholic and apostolic Church.
I confess one Baptism for the forgiveness of sins
and I look forward to the resurrection of the dead
and the life of the world to come. Amen.

This year’s Catholic Ministries Appeal has begun.  Everyone should have received their letter and pledge form by now.  Please be as generous as your means allow.  Every gift is needed and important!  Please pray for the success of our efforts.  Thank you.
   
The next SOS Daily Cash Raffle starts on November 1.  Bright pink tickets are in this week’s bulletin and available in the church entrance or parish office.

Last Call for basket raffle tickets.  Tickets need to be in no later than Monday, October 26. Tickets are available in the church entrance and parish office. 

The Rite of Christian Initiation of Adults and the Rite of Christian Initiation of Children offers those who have never been baptized - or who were baptized in another Christian denomination - or who were baptized Catholic but never received First Eucharist and Confirmation just that opportunity. To find out more, call the office at 429-6811.
Confiteor

I confess to almighty God
and to you, my brothers and sisters,
that I have greatly sinned
in my thoughts and in my words,
in what I have done
and in what I have failed to do,
(striking breast)
through my fault,
through my fault,
through my most grievous fault;
therefore I ask blessed Mary ever-Virgin,
all the Angels and Saints,
and you, my brothers and sisters,
to pray for me to the Lord our God.
Our Father
Invitation to Communion

Priest: Behold the Lamb of God,
behold him who takes away the sins of the world.
Blessed are those called to the supper of the Lamb.

All:  Lord, I am not worthy
that you should enter under my roof,
but only say the word
and my soul shall be healed.

Who can ascend the mountain of the LORD?
or who may stand in his holy place?
One whose hands are sinless, whose heart is clean,
who desires not what is vain.

(Stand)
Priest: Pray, brothers and sisters,
that my sacrifice and yours
may be acceptable to God,
the almighty Father.
The Offertory

All: May the Lord accept the sacrifice at your hands
for the praise and glory of his name,
for our good
and the good of all his holy Church.

We are grateful to everyone who have kept their weekly offerings current and pray that you continue to do so.  In order for us to resume our ministries and programs upon reopening, we need everyone to contribute to our Sunday offering.
 
Sunday envelopes and food donations can be dropped off outside the parish life center on Mondays, Wednesdays and Thursdays from 9-12.    The food cupboard is open and in need of donations.  Please check our bulletin for the needed item of the week.  

Please do not drop off bottles/cans until further notice.

Theo’s Closet is closed until further notice.  Clothing donations made be put in the St. Pauly Shed in the back parking lot.  

Please be sure to let your family, friends and neighbors know that Masses have resumed since we are unable to contact everyone individually.  Please call the office at 429-6811 for more information.

Everyone who has this hope based on
him makes himself pure,
as he is pure.
